text: Greenwood, also known as the Estill-Parrish House, is a historic home located near Fayette, Howard County, Missouri. It was built in 1864, and is a two- story, double pile, Greek Revival style brick dwelling with a two-story rear wing with an arcaded wooden gallery porch. It features fine interior woodwork. Also on the property are the contributing frame meat house, a single-cell slave house, a double-cell slave house, an ice house, and the White Hall School, a one-room frame school house built in 1860. (includes 22 photographs from 1980) It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1983. ==References== Category:One-room schoolhouses in Missouri Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in Missouri Category:Greek Revival houses in Missouri Category:Houses completed in 1864 Category:Buildings and structures in Howard County, Missouri Category:National Register of Historic Places in Howard County, Missouri
title: Greenwood (Fayette, Missouri)
